trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator.AdCreated"></xref> event of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator"></xref> control.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator.AdCreated> event is raised when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator> control displays an advertisement on the page.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdCreatedEventArgs>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdCreatedEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdCreatedEventArgs"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdCreatedEventArgs> class.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdCreatedEventArgs>.
Property
Initial value
The value of the `adProperties` parameter if the `adProperties` parameter is not `null`; otherwise, an empty <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary?displayProperty=fullName>.
If the `adProperties` parameter is not `null`, the value in the `adProperties` parameter that represents the alternate text; otherwise, <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>.

If the `adProperties` parameter is not `null`, the value in the `adProperties` parameter that represents the URL of the image to display; otherwise, <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>.
If the `adProperties` parameter is not `null`, the value in the `adProperties` parameter that represents the URL to navigate to; otherwise, <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>.
A <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> containing the advertisement properties from the XML file.
Gets a <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> object that contains all the advertisement properties for the currently displayed advertisement.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdCreatedEventArgs.AdProperties%2A> property to get a <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary?displayProperty=fullName> object that contains the advertisement properties for the currently displayed advertisement.
The keys and values of the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary?displayProperty=fullName> object are of type <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator> control randomly selects an advertisement each time the control is displayed on the Web page.
The attributes for the selected advertisement are extracted from the advertisement XML file and stored in a <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary?displayProperty=fullName> object.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator> control creates a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdCreatedEventArgs> class, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdCreatedEventArgs.AdProperties%2A> property gets initialized with the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary?displayProperty=fullName> object.
Custom attributes about an advertisement, such as an advertisement caption, can also be included in the advertisement XML file.
Use this property in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator.OnAdCreated%2A> event handler to get the custom attributes.
A <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> that contains a list of advertisement properties for the currently displayed advertisement.
The default value is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
Gets or sets the alternate text displayed in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator"></xref> control when the advertisement image is unavailable.
Browsers that support the ToolTips feature display this text as a ToolTip for the advertisement.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdCreatedEventArgs.AlternateText%2A> property to specify the text to display if the image specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdCreatedEventArgs.ImageUrl%2A> property is not available.
In browsers that support the ToolTips feature, this text also appears as a ToolTip for the advertisement.
A separate XML file contains the properties for the displayed advertisement.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator> control automatically sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdCreatedEventArgs.AlternateText%2A> property with the corresponding alternate text entry in the XML file.
This property can also be used to programmatically set the alternate text.
The text displayed in place of the advertisement image if the image is unavailable.
The default value is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
Gets or sets the URL of an image to display in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator"></xref> control.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdCreatedEventArgs.ImageUrl%2A> property to specify the URL of an image to display for an advertisement in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator> control.
You can use a relative or an absolute URL.
A relative URL relates the location of the image to the location of the Web page or user control without specifying a complete path on the server.
The path is relative to the location of the Web page.
This makes it easier to move the entire site to another directory on the server without updating the path to the image in code.
An absolute URL provides the complete path, so moving the site to another directory requires updating the code.
A separate XML file contains the properties for the displayed advertisement.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator> control automatically sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdCreatedEventArgs.ImageUrl%2A> property with the corresponding image URL entry in the XML file containing the advertisement information.
This property can also be used to programmatically set the image URL.
If you use an advertisement file and specify a relative URL for this property, the URL is relative to the directory that the advertisement file is located in.

If you set this property directly with a relative URL, instead of using the advertisement file, the URL is relative to the directory of the page or user control that contains the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator> control.
The URL of an image to display in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator"></xref> control.
The default value is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
Gets or sets the Web page to display when the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator"></xref> control is clicked.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdCreatedEventArgs.NavigateUrl%2A> property to specify the Web page to display when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator> control is clicked.

A common use for this property is to redirect the navigation, when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator> control is clicked, to a page that can count the number of times the user clicked the advertisement before proceeding to the destination URL.
A separate XML file contains the properties for the displayed advertisement.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator> control automatically sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdCreatedEventArgs.NavigateUrl%2A> property with the corresponding navigation URL entry in the XML file.
This property can also be used to programmatically set the navigation URL.
If you use an advertisement file and specify a relative URL for this property, the URL is relative to the directory that the advertisement file is located in.

If you set this property directly with a relative URL, instead of using the advertisement file, the URL is relative to the directory of the page or user control that contains the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator> control.
The Web page to display when the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AdRotator"></xref> control is clicked.
The default value is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
